page.title: 12Church Life in Stevington
page.content: There are many Baptists whose forbears have lived here for generations.John Bunyan,a Bedford man,preached some three hundred years ago in the lovely seventeenth century chapel in West End Stevington.The Parish Church dates from the ninth century.It overlooks the meadows bordering the River Ouse.Great pride is taken in keeping the churchyard tidy.The vicarage is now a private residence.The Vicar,a recently ordained retired County Planning Officer,lives in the next village.He has restarted the Sunday School,increased church attendance and assisted towards raising the large sum of money needed to restore the fabric of the church.Once there was a Methodist Chapel but this is now an organ workshop.Roman Catholics have to travel to Harrold,Clapham or Bedford to worship.
